Cade
A cycle-accurate DCPU-16 emulator, written in C.
  • Main Page
  • Data Structures
  • Files
  • File List

cade.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002  * Yet another DCPU-16 emulator/virtual machine/whatever.
00003  *
00004  * The acronym is supposed to mean "cycle-accurate dcpu emulator", since that is the
00005  * main goal. Most of the implementations that have popped up the last few days seem
00006  * to ignore the cycle-accurate part, which is understandable. I've never written a
00007  * cycle-accurate CPU emulator though, so that's the itch here.
00008  *
00009  * Written by Emil Brink <emil@obsession.se>, created April 2012.
00010  *
00011  * Of course, also see the DCPU-16 spec at <http://0x10c.com/doc/dcpu-16.txt>.
00012  *
00013  * Licensed under the GNU Lesser General Public License, v3.
00014 */
00015 
00016 #if !defined CADE_H
00017 #define CADE_H
00018 
00019 #include <stdint.h>
00020 #include <stdlib.h>

00032 typedef enum {
00033         DCPU_REG_A = 0,
00034         DCPU_REG_B,
00035         DCPU_REG_C,
00036         DCPU_REG_X,
00037         DCPU_REG_Y,
00038         DCPU_REG_Z,
00039         DCPU_REG_I,
00040         DCPU_REG_J,
00041         DCPU_REG_COUNT
00042 } DCPU_Register;
00043 
00044 typedef struct DCPU_State       DCPU_State;
00045 
00049 #define DCPU_STOP       (0x21 << 10 | (0x1c << 4) | 3)
00050 
00051 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
